Book Review: Drop the Ball by Tiffany Dufu

June 25, 2017

Written by: Skylar Wooden and Katie Butler

If you enjoyed Lean In by Sheryl Sandberg, you’ll want Drop the Ball on your summer reading list. Tiffany Dufu pulls you in with a relatable and witty story of her struggle as a working, new mother who realizes the deck is stacked against her.

Why You Should Write Your Own Blog

June 18, 2017

Written by: Skylar Wooden and Katie Butler

No matter how much you love your work, if you do, having an outlet to do something for yourself is priceless. You are able to do anything you want with your blog, giving you the ability to fulfil yourself however your job doesn’t.

Networking: Why You Should Never Stop

June 11, 2017

Written by: Skylar Wooden and Katie Butler

Staying ahead of the game will come in handy when you’re ready to change jobs, start a volunteer opportunity, or ask advice about your next venture. When this seems like an overwhelming tasks, think of your goals and remember that you may need help climbing your ladder.

How to Prepare for an Employee Review

June 04, 2017

Written by: Skylar Wooden and Katie Butler

You don’t always have your employer’s undivided attention, so now is the time. This is your moment to ask about salary, job growth, and the direction of the company.

How to Have an Effortless Conversation

May 28, 2017

Written by: Skylar Wooden and Katie Butler

As a young professional, it can be difficult to find your own voice. Every new conversation determines the impression you’re going to make and how that will define you as a professional.

Why You Should be Using the Shapr Networking App

May 21, 2017

Written by: Skylar Wooden and Katie Butler

You may have seen an advertisement on Facebook, or another platform, for the Shapr app. We did, and asked ourselves how this could impact our professional development.
